results.title: The Dream (Week 1)
results.creator_credit: Seven Network Limited (Australia), Todd Abbott and Colin Bromley
results.brief_description: A more lighthearted approach to the Olympic Games. Highlights from the television progam ‘The Dream with Roy and HG’ (John Doyle and Greig Pickhaver) which ran nightly for the duration of the Sydney Olympic Games. Includes highlights of events and interviews with popular Olympians - both past and present. This tape shows highlights of week one including Eric Moussambini’s historic solo 100 metre swim, the Russian Gymnastics, diving, rowing and judo finals.

results.title: The Drawings of Leonardo Da Vinci (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: BFI, Basil Wright and Adrian de Potier
results.brief_description: Drawings and notes of Leonardo da Vinci from the Royal Collection at Windsor Castle, the Royal Academy and the British Museum with some comment and explanation, to celebrate the quincentenary of Leonardo’s birth. Narrated by Sir Laurence Olivier.

results.title: The Draughtsman's contract
results.creator_credit: Channel Four Television, David Payne and Peter Greenaway
results.brief_description: It is the summer of 1694. An ambitious young draughtsman is contracted to draw the house and estate of the wealthy Mrs Herbert. However, what outwardly appears to be a most proper household is thrown into chaos as his contract includes unrestricted freedom on the estate and Mrs Herbert’s most intimate hospitality. Not even Mrs Herbert’s daughter escapes his charm and magnetism in this intriguing movie of murder, adultery and double values.

results.title: The Dragons of the Galapagos
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), BBC-TV, National Geographic Society and Dione Gilmour
results.brief_description: Filmed by David Parer and Elizabeth Parer-Cook and narrated by David Attenborough, this spectacular production tells the story of the incredible struggle for survival of the dragons of the Galapagos Archipelago. The lives of these giant lizards, called land iguanas, are intimately linked with the Archipelagos most active volcano. We follow the annual migration of the land iguanas up the steep slopes of the 1,500 metre volcano and into the steaming caldera where they lay their eggs. Along the coast of the island the worlds only sea-going lizards take us into one of the most exciting marine environments on earth, a world of huge balls of baitfish and masses of seals, dolphins and penguins.

results.title: The Dragon stirs
results.creator_credit: CCTV, Southern Star Entertainment, ABC-TV (Australia), Yuan Zhengming, Chen Meng, Zhao Shujing, Yu Bo, Wei Bin, Lin Xiezhong, Liu Chun, Qi Kejun and Xue Song
results.brief_description: A four-part historical series about China with the first two parts focussing on two major natural disasters which occurred during the 20th century and the final two parts exploring the role of China’s women and their struggle for equality. Narrated by Peter George and Diana McLean.

results.title: The Dragon's tears
results.creator_credit: Contemproary Films, McGraw-Hill Films and John Korty
results.brief_description: An animated adaptation of Hirosuke Hamada’s story of a little boy’s fearless act of inviting a dragon to his birthday party. Utilizes Japanese-style watercolour and art work. Narrated by Robert Morse. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

results.title: The Drag
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Wolf Koenig, Robert Verrall and Carlos Marchiori
results.brief_description: Animated cartoon about a young man who becomes a chain smoker. Explains to young people the psychology of the smoking habit, including the part played by cigarette advertising.

results.title: The Dove
results.creator_credit: St George Productions, Gregory Peck and Charles Jarrott
results.brief_description: Based on the book “Dove” by Robin Lee Graham and Derek Gill this film depicts the true story of Graham’s five year solo voyage around the world. The photography is breathtaking, as we follow Graham (Joseph Bottoms) as he sails to Fiji, Australia, Mozambique, South Africa and Los Angeles, covering a distance of 30,000 miles. Graham has no human contact during his trip, just the companionship of his cats. However, when he stops at Fiji he falls in love with Patti Ratteree (Deborah Raffin), and his departure from her is more painful due to his isolation. An inspirational film about courage and ambition that can be enjoyed by the whole family.
